user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of handle_req_chunk_size_line_no_space:
```c
static void
handle_req_chunk_size_line_no_space (struct MHD_Connection *c,
                                     const char *chunk_size_line,
                                     size_t chunk_size_line_size)
{
  unsigned int err_code;

  if (NULL != chunk_size_line)
  {
    const char *semicol;
    /* Check for chunk extension */
    semicol = memchr (chunk_size_line, ';', chunk_size_line_size);
    if (NULL != semicol)
    { /* Chunk extension present. It could be removed without any loss of the
         details of the request. */
      transmit_error_response_static (c,
                                      MHD_HTTP_CONTENT_TOO_LARGE,
                                      ERR_MSG_REQUEST_CHUNK_LINE_EXT_TOO_BIG);
    }
  }
  err_code = get_no_space_err_status_code (c,
                                           MHD_PROC_RECV_BODY_CHUNKED,
                                           chunk_size_line,
                                           chunk_size_line_size);
  transmit_error_response_static (c,
                                  err_code,
                                  ERR_MSG_REQUEST_CHUNK_LINE_TOO_BIG);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 specifically forbids using memcmp to compare null-terminated strings. The provided function contains no calls to memcmp. It uses memchr (to locate ';' within a buffer of given size), which does not violate the rule because it is a search function and operates with an explicit length rather than comparing null-terminated strings. The other calls in this fragment (get_no_space_err_status_code and transmit_error_response_static) are function calls but contain no visible memcmp usage in this code fragment; without their implementations there is no evidence here of memcmp being used. Therefore there are no code fragments in the shown function that need investigation for Rule 21.14.
